explanation: The bug was that the code always computed p using the original P (P - Q + d) instead of using the current best result res. That prevents iterative updates that depend on previously reduced values. I fixed the single incorrect line by replacing P with res so p is computed as (res - Q + d). Only that one line was changed.
fixed_code:
N, P, Q = map(int, input().split())
D = list(map(int, input().split()))

res = P

for d in D:
    if (p := res - Q + d) < res:
        res = p

print(res)
